duties_responsibilities.duty: Co-teach in a trauma-responsive preschool program serving children ages 3-5 years, focusing on social and emotional development.
Create and implement developmentally appropriate learning activities and lesson plans.
Use TS Gold assessment data to individualize education and care to meet children’s needs.
Assess learners’ growth and development using Teaching Strategies Gold, and provide interventions for children using assessment data.
Maintain a clean, safe, engaging classroom environment, free of physical, psychological, and emotional dangers.
Establish consistent routines that foster self-esteem, security, and connection using the Conscious Discipline approach.

Create and maintain effective and consistent communication with families, facilitating home visits and conferences for goal setting and informing parents/guardians of children’s growth and development.
Collaborate and communicate with team members to provide the best environment for young children and the program as a whole.
Reflect on, improve, and enhance the environment and instructional practices on an ongoing basis.

Plan and implement activities to meet the physical, emotional, intellectual, and social needs of the children in the program. Promote inclusion through equitable practices in a culturally competent teaching position.
Create and follow lesson plans based on Creative Curriculum and Second Step Social Emotional Curriculum.
Assess students on an ongoing basis and document children’s progress toward improving learning outcomes.
Provide partners with families that promote family engagement and participation in children’s education and learning.

education_certification.credential: Bachelor’s degree in Early Childhood Education or related field (Master's preferred)
